title: The Biden-Trump Presidential Debate
content:
JAKE TAPPER, CNN MODERATOR: Georgia — "We’re live from Georgia, a key battleground state in the race for the White House."
JAKE TAPPER, CNN MODERATOR: United States — "We want to welcome our viewers in the United States and around the world to our studios in Atlanta."
JAKE TAPPER, CNN MODERATOR: Atlanta — "We want to welcome our viewers in the United States and around the world to our studios in Atlanta."
TAPPER: United States — "Now please welcome the 46th president of the United States, Joe Biden."
TAPPER: United States — "And please welcome the 45th president of the United States, Donald Trump."
BIDEN: Scranton, Pennsylvania — "I come from Scranton, Pennsylvania. I come from a household where the kitchen table — if things weren’t able to be met during the month was a problem."
TAPPER: U.S. — "You want to impose a 10 percent tariff on all goods coming into the U.S. How will you ensure that that doesn’t drive prices even higher?"
TRUMP: China — "…countries that have been ripping us off for years, like China and many others, in all fairness to China — it’s going to just force them to pay us a lot of money…"
TRUMP: Afghanistan — "And as far as Afghanistan is concerned, I was getting out of Afghanistan, but we were getting out with dignity, with strength, with power."
BASH: Idaho — "This morning, the court ruled on yet another abortion case, temporarily allowing emergency abortions to continue in Idaho despite that state’s restrictive ban."
TRUMP: Ohio — "Now the states are working it out. If you look at Ohio, it was a decision that was — that was an end result that was a little bit more liberal than you would have thought."
TRUMP: Kansas — "Kansas I would say the same thing."
TRUMP: Texas — "Texas is different."
TRUMP: Florida — "Florida is different."
TRUMP: Virginia — "If you look at the former governor of Virginia, he was willing to do this. He said, we’ll put the baby aside…"
TAPPER: New York — "…overwhelming border states and overburdening cities such as New York and Chicago…"
TAPPER: Chicago — "…overwhelming border states and overburdening cities such as New York and Chicago…"
TRUMP: South America — "All terrorists, all over the world — not just in South America, all over the world."
TRUMP: Middle East — "They come from the Middle East, everywhere. All over the world, they’re pouring in."
TRUMP: New York — "They’re killing our people in New York, in California, in every state in the union…"
TRUMP: California — "They’re killing our people in New York, in California, in every state in the union…"
TRUMP: every state in the union — "They’re killing our people in New York, in California, in every state in the union…"
TRUMP: New York City — "Just take a look at where they’re living. They’re living in luxury hotels in New York City and other places."
BIDEN: France — "I was recently in — in France for D-Day, and I spoke to all — about those heroes that died."
BIDEN: World War II cemetery — "I went to the World War II cemetery — World War I cemetery he refused to go to."
BIDEN: World War I cemetery — "I went to the World War II cemetery — World War I cemetery he refused to go to."
BASH: Russia — "Let’s begin with Russia’s war against Ukraine, which is now in its third year."
BASH: Ukraine — "Let’s begin with Russia’s war against Ukraine, which is now in its third year."
TRUMP: Afghanistan — "It was such a horrible embarrassment, most embarrassing moment in the history of our country, Afghanistan, where we left billions of dollars of equipment behind…"
TRUMP: Kyiv — "Listen to what he said when he went in, he was going to take Kyiv in five days, remember?"
TRUMP: Soviet Union — "Because it’s part of the old Soviet Union. That’s what he wanted to re-establish, Kyiv."
BIDEN: Iran — "Iran attacked American troops, killed, caused brain damage for a number of these troops…"
BIDEN: Afghanistan — "We got over 100,000 Americans and others out of Afghanistan during that airlift."
BIDEN: Ukraine — "If you take a look at what Trump did in Ukraine…"
BASH: Middle East — "Moving on to the Middle East, in October, Hamas attacked Israel…"
BASH: Israel — "…Hamas attacked Israel, killing more than a thousand people and taking hundreds of hostages."
BASH: Palestinians — "Israel’s response has killed thousands of Palestinians and created a humanitarian crisis in Gaza."
BASH: Gaza — "…created a humanitarian crisis in Gaza."
BIDEN: United Nations Security Council — "Number one, everyone from the United Nations Security Council straight through to the G7 to the Israelis and Netanyahu himself have endorsed the plan I put forward…"
BIDEN: G7 — "Number one, everyone from the United Nations Security Council straight through to the G7…"
BIDEN: Israel — "…to the Israelis and Netanyahu himself have endorsed the plan I put forward…"
TRUMP: Ukraine — "Just going back to Ukraine for one second, we have an ocean separating us. The European nations together have spent $100 billion…"
TRUMP: European nations — "Just going back to Ukraine for one second, we have an ocean separating us. The European nations together have spent $100 billion…"
TRUMP: NATO — "Why doesn’t he call them so you got to put up your money like I did with NATO? I got them to put up hundreds of billions of dollars."
TRUMP: Israel — "As far as Israel and Hamas, Israel’s the one that wants to go — he said the only one who wants to keep going is Hamas. Actually, Israel is the one."
BIDEN: Japan — "I got 50 other nations around the world to support Ukraine, including Japan…"
BIDEN: South Korea — "…and South Korea, because they understand that this was — this kind of dislocation has a serious threat to the whole world peace."
TAPPER: Capitol — "After you rallied your supporters that day, some of them stormed the Capitol to stop the constitutionally mandated counting of electoral votes."
TRUMP: Portland — "When they ripped down Portland, when they ripped down many other cities — you go to Minnesota, Minneapolis…"
TRUMP: Minnesota — "When they ripped down Portland, when they ripped down many other cities — you go to Minnesota, Minneapolis…"
TRUMP: Minneapolis — "When they ripped down Portland, when they ripped down many other cities — you go to Minnesota, Minneapolis…"
TRUMP: Seattle — "They took over big chunks of Seattle. I was all set to bring in the National Guard. They heard that, they saw them coming and they left immediately."
TRUMP: Manhattan — "They moved a high-ranking official, a DOJ, into the Manhattan D.A.’s office to start that case."
BIDEN: Charlottesville, Virginia — "Until I saw what happened in Charlottesville, Virginia, people coming out of the woods carrying swastikas on torches — torches and singing the same antisemitic bile…"
BIDEN: Germany — "…singing the same antisemitic bile they sang when — back in Germany."
TAPPER: D.C. — "I offered 10,000 soldiers or National Guard, and she turned them down. And the mayor of — in writing, by the way, the mayor. In writing turned it down, the mayor of D.C."
BASH: Georgia — "Welcome back to the CNN Presidential Debate live from Georgia."
TRUMP: South Carolina — "…Tim Scott was - incredible, he did a great job, a great Senator from South Carolina."
BIDEN: Paris — "I immediately joined it, because if we reach for 1.5 degrees Celsius at any one point, well, there is no way back. The only existential threat to humanity is climate change."
TRUMP: Mexico — "He ended remain in Mexico, he ended catch and release. I made it catch and release in Mexico, not catch and release here."
BIDEN: Mexico — "And Mexico is working with us to make sure they don’t have the technology to be able to put it together. That’s what we have to do."
TRUMP: Manhattan — "…moved a high-ranking official, a DOJ, into the Manhattan D.A.’s office to start that case." (repeat mention)
TRUMP: North Korea — "Kim Jong-Un of North Korea…"
BIDEN: Poland — "What do you think happens to Poland? What do you think of Belarus? What do you think happens to those NATO countries?"
BIDEN: Belarus — "What do you think happens to Poland? What do you think of Belarus? What do you think happens to those NATO countries?"
BASH / BIDEN: Hungary — "See what happens in Poland, Hungary, and other places along that border."
TRUMP: United States of America — "What we’re doing for other countries, and they do nothing for us. What this man has done is absolutely criminal to the United States of America."
